Params: {2: 'Want to go somewhere together, Liv?', 3: '6', 4: "I'm not sure.", 5: '500'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Okay. We haven't done anything together in a while, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{3: "As soon as you leave, you see a small figure curled up in the chair behind youâ€”the girl who was listening to Liv's story earlier."}
{3: "She fell asleep on the chair. Her face has a red mark from the arm of the chair, but she's still sound asleep."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Um... She told me she was all by herself when we first met. No friends or family.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Wake her up.', 3: '16', 4: 'How about we wake her up, Liv?', 5: '24'}
{3: "You gently tap the arm of the chair she's resting her head on. Awoken by the strange sound, she yawns softly and stretches like a tired kitten."}
{3: 'She opens her eyes and, a few moments later, looks at the strangers standing before her.'}
{2: 'Girl', 3: "...Huh? You're that dancing robot... And the robot telling stories!", 4: '2'}
{3: "Liv kneels down and gently strokes the girl's hair."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Time to wake up. You'll catch a cold if you keep sleeping on the chair.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Resting her head on the arm of the chair, the tired "kitten" hears the strange sound, yawns softly, and stretches.'}
{2: 'Girl', 3: "Huh... Who's that? Oh, the dancing robot...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Why are you here all by yourself?', 3: '34'}
{2: 'Girl', 3: "I'm waiting for my mommy and daddy.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Girl', 3: "But I've waited so long... And they're still not back. They don't want me anymore. Do they?", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Hearing this, Liv looks at you gloomily, as if to confirm you are thinking what she is.'}
{3: 'Whether or not they know the answer to this question, most of the children left in the conservation area had lost their parents...'}
{3: "Unfortunately, this child doesn't seem to be the exception."}
{3: 'But who can bring themselves to shatter her hope?'}
{3: 'The girl hesitates a moment and looks at the crowd off in the distance.'}
{2: 'Ellie', 3: "I haven't made any friends here yet. Mommy and Daddy aren't back either...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Want to come and play with us?', 3: '51'}
{3: 'Her dark eyes suddenly burst into light. Seems like she had been waiting for someone to invite her for quite some time.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Of course! We're going to try out some of the activities here.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ellie', 3: 'Oh, I know those. You just need to join the events, and you can ask the old lady for Star Tickets.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Which one do you wanna do first?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She points to an area beside the convention hall.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'The one where three people tie their legs together and race?', 4: '1'}
{2: "Won't that be hard for Ellie to do with us?", 3: '66'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "She's not as tall as us, but we can run at her speed.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You go with Ellie and Liv to the track.'}
{3: "You adjust the bandage tying you and Ellie's legs together. Even though the bandage is wrapped around your foot, it comes up to Ellie's calf."}
{3: 'As long as you and Liv hold her up in the air and let her feet move with your legs, you can avoid tripping over each other due to such a large difference in your strides.'}
{3: 'Supporting Ellie with your arms, you and Liv can run together one foot after another.'}
{2: 'We need to say "left, right, left right" together.'}
{3: 'Just as she crosses the finish line, Ellie falls with a scream and drags Liv down to the ground with her.'}
{2: 'Staff Member', 3: 'Even though you fell right at the end, you still managed to cross the finish line. Also...'}
{2: 'Staff Member', 3: 'You three are the fastest with a child in the race. Here is the prize for first place.'}
{2: 'Staff Member', 3: "It's hard enough with three people as it is, let alone with a child."}
{2: 'Staff Member', 3: 'Thank you for doing it with Ellie.'}
{2: 'Staff Member', 3: "Here's your reward. The first place prize is candy and chocolate."}
{3: 'The little girl shakes her head like crazy.'}
{2: 'Ellie', 3: 'I love chocolate! Especially winning it with you two. But...', 4: '2'}
{3: 'She fixes her gaze on a straw bracelet, which is a commemoration award for anyone who failed to place in a game.'}
{2: 'Ellie', 3: 'Yeah... Mommy made one for me. But it was ruined after all the rain...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Okay, we'll go do another event and bring you the prize. How's that sound?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Well, we still need more Star Tickets.', 3: '121', 4: "As long as it's with you, Liv.", 5: '122'}
